title: 110_s477
content:
The "American Falls Reservoir District Number 2 Conveyance Act" defines terms like Agreement, District, and Secretary, and grants authority to convey title. The Act grants the Secretary authority to convey land and improvements to the District, city of Gooding, and Idaho Department of Fish and Game, subject to valid existing rights and compliance with the Agreement. SEC. 4. TRANSFER. The Secretary will direct the National Park Service to manage 10.18 acres of land as part of the Minidoka Internment National Monument. SEC. 5. COMPLIANCE WITH OTHER LAWS. The District must comply with all applicable laws upon conveyance of the land. SEC. 6. REVOCATION OF WITHDRAWALS. SEC. 6. REVOCATION OF WITHDRAWALS. The Secretary revokes withdrawals of approximately 6,900 acres for the Gooding Division of the Minidoka Project. The Bureau of Land Management will manage the land subject to valid existing rights. SEC. 7. LIABILITY. SEC. 7. LIABILITY. Upon completion of a conveyance under section 3, the United States is not liable for damages for any injury related to the land conveyed, except for negligence committed before the conveyance. This does not increase liability beyond what is provided in the Federal Tort Claims Act. After the conveyance of land and improvements to the District, the District is responsible for all costs associated with the operation and maintenance of the transferred land. The District is not eligible for federal funding for these activities, except in cases where funding would be available to a similarly situated nonreclamation district. Additionally, the National Environmental Policy Act is addressed in Section 9. Before completing any conveyance under this Act, the Secretary shall complete all actions required under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, the Endangered Species Act of 1973, the National Historic Preservation Act, and all other applicable laws. SEC. 10. PAYMENT.

(a) Fair Market Value Requirement--The District must pay fair market value for the lands to be acquired under the Agreement.
(b) Grant for Building Replacement--The Secretary will provide a grant of $52,996 to the District for the replacement of a structure to be transferred to the National Park Service.
